text: the last image I have is my sister dying
on my lap it's definitely an image I'll
never get out of my head you know even
30 years later I still remember it all
like it was yesterday
June 5th 1989 the night before the
accident there was a robbery in the area
my dad had you know got the gun out and
loaded it it was my father-in-law's her
mother-in-law's gun somebody had it and
they gave it to my husband to get rid of
the dogs were going crazy after talking
to the police officers that were in the
area being three o'clock in the morning
came back put the gun in his drawer and
went back to bed so the next day I got
home always came home five minutes
before me I was looking for my video
games or whatever reason he went in
looking in our drawers instead of the
video games I found my dad's gun pulled
it out and thinking you know like any
other toy gun you know to try to play
with it because he's left-handed
he swung the gun towards the window my
sister got freaked out and she was
running out of the room said she wasn't
getting in trouble for this so ran
between him and it was just as the gun
went off perfect shot and by the time I
got home police were everywhere it
happened so quickly
accidents happen quick
[Music]
I remember wanting to go to school just
to like get back to normal in some way
and then it was it was more everybody
else trying to deal with what I've just
dealt with people were sympathetic at
first there was a spotlight on us for
sure and it wasn't really people caring
about you know it was more they wanted
us to pick a side and I had nobody to be
angry at
I had a ten-year-old little boy then you
know there was an accident some people
asked did he do it on purpose no you
know if you see all the pictures of
Aaron and Shawn together they always
have their arms around each other
they you know he protected her that was
the hardest part was people voicing
their opinions about stuff they didn't
know about
[Music]
a lot of years went by or I you know
didn't talk to my father a lot because
either I blame myself or he blamed
himself or we blamed each other once I
got into my my teen years it was it was
rough I had all this guilt I got very
self-destructive stealing whenever I
could and then once drugs got into the
picture
I just ran with that and just using way
too much once I found out that I was
gonna be a father that definitely opened
my eyes that I had to be not only
responsible for myself to be there for
him but I was responsible for you know
another life now it challenged him for
the rest of his life he's 40 years old
now and you know he's had a lot of
obstacles to come over I do pray in the
morning and
make sure I forgive myself
you know which I've done many times
before after I got out of rehab and
started my my road to recovery the beach
I found was a very serene place because
I would go there early enough where
there was no people there I had the
pleasure of watching so many sunrises
and seeing the beautiful sky and it
definitely connected me to her there's
always gonna be a curiosity with kids
with guns so to have them in the home in
the first place that's just pushing
their curiosity button it can happen in
a millisecond and it changes your life
forever
